Sentencas: A promising candidate to fulfil the solid oxide fuel cell sealant requirements with respect to gas tightness, high temperature stability and electrical insulation appear to be glass-ceramic sealing materials.
Titulo: Elevated temperature effects on the mechanical properties of solid oxide fuel cell sealing materials

Sentencas: However, the reliable operation of solid oxide fuel cell stacks depends strongly on the structural integrity of the sealing materials.
Titulo: Elevated temperature effects on the mechanical properties of solid oxide fuel cell sealing materials

Sentencas: In this respect failure and deformation are aspects which need to be assessed in particular for glass ceramic sealant materials.
Titulo: Elevated temperature effects on the mechanical properties of solid oxide fuel cell sealing materials

Sentencas: Bending tests were carried at room temperature and typical stack operation temperature for glass ceramic sealants with different degree of crystallization.
Titulo: Elevated temperature effects on the mechanical properties of solid oxide fuel cell sealing materials

Sentencas: Elastic moduli, fracture stresses and viscosity values are reported.
Titulo: Elevated temperature effects on the mechanical properties of solid oxide fuel cell sealing materials

Sentencas: In addition to sintered bars bending testing were carried out for steel specimens that were head-to-head joined with the glass ceramics similar as in a stack application, where the ceramic particle reinforced sealant material was screen printed onto the steel.
Titulo: Elevated temperature effects on the mechanical properties of solid oxide fuel cell sealing materials

Sentencas: The results reveal a decrease of the strength for the partially crystallized sealant at operation relevant temperatures that can be associated with the viscous deformation.
Titulo: Elevated temperature effects on the mechanical properties of solid oxide fuel cell sealing materials

Sentencas: Fractographic analyses based on a combination of optical, confocal and scanning electron microscopy gave insight into the failure origin.
